content.description: TW and I cleaned this off in 2013. The moves aren't too hard, but the commitment factor is.
content.location: Start about 10 feet left of the water groove feature on a high sloping jug.

content.description: Climb up the large water groove, using slopers and pockets. Crux is near the top.
content.protection: Pads + Spotter. You'll probably want to get on a rope and clean off all the holds as well, due to the problem not getting much traffic.
content.location: Twin Eagles is to the right and around the corner from Brown Recluse.

content.description: This epic slab climbs up two "tubes" in the dead center of a trio of water runnels on this slab section of the cliff. Begin right hand on a nice jug edge and left on a jug undercling. Climb out left to a sloping rail and then up some pockets to a hueco. From here bust out right to an awesome pocket and with good feet and then up and right into the first tube. Arrive at a good hueco (and hidden jug mono!) and brace yourself for the crux. Go up to a  sloper and from here execute a dicey mantle lock off to a lefty pinch at the top of the second tube. Hand foot match and lock off to a nice crimp. From here continue up and left for a few more moves and the gain the amazing finishing jug and top out this massive line. I highly recommend trying this one on rope first!https://youtu.be/banHNXqU2QkHere is the video at 5:13
content.protection: Lots of foam and not falling! The landing is flat thankfully.
content.location: This is located on the same cliff line as Cripps V9, up the hill from the brown recluse boulder. To the right of Cripps on the slab part of the cliff.

content.description: This thing is absolutely crazy! You begin under a short roof, get set up on a couple crimps and do a huge dyno to a sloper. Then work up using the slopers, a mono, and a heel-toe cam. The second crux is throwing to the lip. After this you top out on about 10 feet of slab, 20 feet off the ground.
content.location: Cripps is located up the hill from Brown Recluse on the cliff line.

content.description: From a sit-start just left of the middle of the face on a right hand sloper hueco, and a left hand juggy hueco, climb left and then upwards on cool sloping jugs. Move out right for first crux move before finally heading straight up and left on fingery holds to the scary and difficult topout.
content.protection: Many pads, as the landing isn't perfect and a fall near the top of this big boulder is possible!

content.description: Start in the good, high horizontal.
content.location: On the cliffline just up hill from BR boulder.

content.description: A beautiful boulder with one of the best problems for the grade the Midwest has to offer. Worth the hike. Nice, relaxing vibe.
